data.title: Dresser mss., 1897
data.text:
Papers of Paul Dresser at the Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana

Electronic finding aid encoded by Indiana University Libraries.

Summary Information

Repository

Lilly Library (Indiana University, Bloomington)

Indiana University

1200 E. Seventh St.

Bloomington, IN 47405-5500

Phone: 812-855-2452

Fax: 812-855-3143

Email: liblilly@indiana.edu

http://www.indiana.edu/~liblilly

Creator

Dresser, Paul, 1858-1906

Title

Dresser mss., 1897-1904

Collection No.

LMC 1290

Extent

1 box, 1 oversize

Language

Materials are in English.

Abstract

The Dresser mss., 1897-1904, consist of letters of Paul Dresser, 1858-1906, song writer, to Mary Ellis South, 1880-1968.

Access Restrictions

This collection is open for research.

Biographical Note

Paul Dresser, 1858-1906, song writer.

Scope and Content Note

The Dresser mss., 1897-1904, consist of letters of Paul Dresser, 1857-1906, song writer, to Mary Ellis South, 1880- 1968, to whom he dedicated "On the Banks of the Wabash;" newspaper clippings relating to Paul Dresser and to Miss South; a photograph of Paul Dresser; a photograph of his birthplace in Terre Haute, Indiana; and a ms. copy of Louise Dresser's [Reminiscences of Paul Dresser and account of how she happened to take the stage name, "Dresser"].

Indexing Terms

Names

Dresser, Paul, 1858-1906

Administrative Information

Acquisition Information

Gift: 1960, 1962

Usage Restrictions

Prior arrangements are not necessary before coming to the Library, however, patrons from out of town are encouraged to communicate with the Library in advance of their visits to ascertain availability of materials.

Photocopying permitted only with permission of the curator.

Preferred Citation

[Item], Dresser mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.
